intro: Peristrophe teklei, commonly known as the Ethiopian spurge, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture. The flowers are small and clustered, with both male and female flowers present on the same plant.
